availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Vanhoose (Johnson County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Married to Elizabeth Vanhoose. Father of Sarah J. Vanhoose, Marion Vanhoose, Frances Vanhoose, Mary Vanhoose, Hasco Vanhoose, Thomas Vanhoose, Amanda Vanhoose, Tilda Vanhoose, and Julia Vanhoose. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850 and 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as private from May 21, 1864 to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 86A.
